title: Grassington Circular Walk Route

images.title: HENRY CLARK [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Grassington Village Square

images.title: Peter Church [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Wharfe approaching Hebden. Looking upstream from the suspension bridge at Hebden. The path (Dales Way) is on the eastern bank by the trees.

images.title: Peter Church [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hebden Stepping Stones and Bridge over the Wharfe. A choice of crossings over the river. Wharfe There are the popular stepping stones and there is also the suspension bridge (or you can wade across). The stepping stones are a little variable in spacing, and the bridge is a little wobbly in the middle.

images.title: John Sparshatt [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Along the Hebden Beck to Hebden

images.title: Anthony Eden [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cottages in Hebden. The old stone bridge is over Hebden Beck.

images.title: Peter Church [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Countryside above the town. Garrs Lathe is the prominent building, being a shelter and food store for cattle. The meadows are used for hay making, and the fields further up the hillside are used for grazing sheep and cows.

images.title: John Naisbitt [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Through the meadows returning to Grassington

images.title: Chris Heaton [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Grassington High Street. Looking up Main Street from the Famous Wine Shop in Grassington, as it passes through The Square

description: A lovely circular walk around Grassington, taking you along the River Wharfe to the village of Hebden before climbing into the countryside above the town. Along the way there's pretty weirs, waterfalls and fabulous views over Wharfdale from the high points. Starting in the town centre you head west to the river where you pick up the Dales Way long distance trail. Follow the trail east past Linton Falls to the stepping stones and suspension bridge where you cross the river. The route then follows the waters of Hebden Beck into the little village of Hebden. It's about the halfway point on the walk, so a nice place to stop for refreshments. After leaving the village you follow High Lane west through some lovely countryside. This section climbs to a height of nearly 800ft so there's great views to enjoy here. If you wish you can head north to Garnshaw House and Edge Top to go even higher. At the end of High Lane you descend back into Grassington where the route finishes. To extend your walking in the area you can try our alternative Walk around Grassington which takes you up to the lovely Grimwith Reservoir. You could also continue south along the Dales Way and visit the wonderful Bolton Abbey where there's some nice trails to follow around the atmospheric ruins of a 12th-century Augustinian monastery.
